intro: Anthephora argentea, commonly known as silver anthephora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its silver-white undersides on its leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom during the summer months. Anthephora argentea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
